meanings.definition: The quality or state of being capable of undergoing fission.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the fissionability of the atom.
meanings.sent2: Nuclear reactors rely on the fissionability of certain elements.
meanings.sent3: The fissionability of the cake made it easy to share with everyone.
meanings.sent4: The team's unity had a fissionability that led to great success.
meanings.sent5: The fissionability of the rock made it perfect for splitting into smaller pieces.

meanings.definition: The ability to split or divide into parts.
meanings.sent1: She marveled at the fissionability of the cell under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The knife's sharpness determined its fissionability through the tough meat.
meanings.sent3: The fissionability of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to put together.
meanings.sent4: The community's fissionability allowed them to tackle big projects effectively.
meanings.sent5: The fissionability of the fabric made it easy to tear into strips for crafting.
